The photo was published on Weibo on Octo: 2020, and has been shared more than 400 times.
The post: s caption translates to English, mentioning that the braid was pulled from Emperor Qianlong's head by Sun Dianying, a Chinese warlord who looted Qianlong's tomb in 1928.
Chinese state media Xinhua confirms that: serving leader in Chinese history, ruling from 1735-1796 during the Qing Dynasty.
Chinese scholar Xu Guangyuan: known for his expertise in mausoleums and empresses of the Qing Dynasty, published a Weibo post on October 24, 2020, clarifying that the braid belongs to Consort Rong, one of Emperor Qianlong's spouses.
